intro: Hypochaeris stellata, commonly known as the star dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and alternate. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, similar to other members of the dandelion genus. Hypochaeris stellata is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
